00031 /*
00032  * A Quota Master Target has a hash table where it stores qmt_pool_info
00033  * structures. There is one such structure for each pool managed by the QMT.
00034  *
00035  * Each pool can have different quota types enforced (typically user & group
00036  * quota). A pool is in charge of managing lquota_entry structures for each
00037  * quota type. This is done by creating one lquota_entry site per quota
00038  * type. A site stores entries in a hash table and read quota settings from disk
00039  * when a given ID isn't present in the hash.
00040  *
00041  * The pool API exported here is the following:
00042  * - qmt_pool_init(): initializes the general QMT structures used to manage
00043  *                    pools.
00044  * - qmt_pool_fini(): frees the structures allocated by qmt_pool_fini().
00045  * - qmt_pool_prepare(): sets up the on-disk indexes associated with each pool.
00046  * - qmt_pool_new_conn(): is used to create a new slave index file.
00047  * - qmt_pool_lqe_lookup(): returns an up-to-date lquota entry associated with
00048  *                          a given ID.
00049  */
00050 
00051 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LQUOTA
00052 
00053 #include <obd_class.h>
00054 #include <lprocfs_status.h>
00055 #include "qmt_internal.h"
00056 
00057 static void qmt_pool_free(const struct lu_env *, struct qmt_pool_info *);
00058 
00059 /*
00060  * Static helper functions not used outside the scope of this file
00061  */
00062 
00063 /*
00064  * Reference counter management for qmt_pool_info structures
00065  */
00066 static inline void qpi_getref(struct qmt_pool_info *pool)
00067 {
00068         atomic_inc(&pool->qpi_ref);
00069 }
00070 
00071 static inline void qpi_putref(const struct lu_env *env,
00072                               struct qmt_pool_info *pool)
00073 {
00074         LASSERT(atomic_read(&pool->qpi_ref) > 0);
00075         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&pool->qpi_ref))
00076                 qmt_pool_free(env, pool);
00077 }
00078 
00079 static inline void qpi_putref_locked(struct qmt_pool_info *pool)
00080 {
00081         LASSERT(atomic_read(&pool->qpi_ref) > 1);
00082         atomic_dec(&pool->qpi_ref);
00083 }
00084 
00085 /*
00086  * Hash functions for qmt_pool_info management
00087  */
00088 
00089 static unsigned
00090 qpi_hash_hash(struct cfs_hash *hs, const void *key, unsigned mask)
00091 {
00092         return cfs_hash_u32_hash(*((__u32 *)key), mask);
00093 }
00094 
00095 static void *qpi_hash_key(struct hlist_node *hnode)
00096 {
00097         struct qmt_pool_info *pool;
00098         pool = hlist_entry(hnode, struct qmt_pool_info, qpi_hash);
00099         return &pool->qpi_key;
00100 }
00101 
00102 static int qpi_hash_keycmp(const void *key, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00103 {
00104         struct qmt_pool_info *pool;
00105         pool = hlist_entry(hnode, struct qmt_pool_info, qpi_hash);
00106         return pool->qpi_key == *((__u32 *)key);
00107 }
00108 
00109 static void *qpi_hash_object(struct hlist_node *hnode)
00110 {
00111         return hlist_entry(hnode, struct qmt_pool_info, qpi_hash);
00112 }
00113 
00114 static void qpi_hash_get(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00115 {
00116         struct qmt_pool_info *pool;
00117         pool = hlist_entry(hnode, struct qmt_pool_info, qpi_hash);
00118         qpi_getref(pool);
00119 }
00120 
00121 static void qpi_hash_put_locked(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00122 {
00123         struct qmt_pool_info *pool;
00124         pool = hlist_entry(hnode, struct qmt_pool_info, qpi_hash);
00125         qpi_putref_locked(pool);
00126 }
00127 
00128 static void qpi_hash_exit(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00129 {
00130         CERROR("Should not have any item left!\n");
00131 }
00132 
00133 /* vector of hash operations */
00134 static struct cfs_hash_ops qpi_hash_ops = {
00135         .hs_hash        = qpi_hash_hash,
00136         .hs_key         = qpi_hash_key,
00137         .hs_keycmp      = qpi_hash_keycmp,
00138         .hs_object      = qpi_hash_object,
00139         .hs_get         = qpi_hash_get,
00140         .hs_put_locked  = qpi_hash_put_locked,
00141         .hs_exit        = qpi_hash_exit
00142 };

00144 /* some procfs helpers */
00145 static int qpi_state_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00146 {
00147         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool = m->private;
00148         int                      type;
00149 
00150         LASSERT(pool != NULL);
00151 
00152         seq_printf(m, "pool:\n"
00153                    "    id: %u\n"
00154                    "    type: %s\n"
00155                    "    ref: %d\n"
00156                    "    least qunit: %lu\n",
00157                    pool->qpi_key & 0x0000ffff,
00158                    RES_NAME(pool->qpi_key >> 16),
00159                    atomic_read(&pool->qpi_ref),
00160                    pool->qpi_least_qunit);
00161 
00162         for (type = 0; type < MAXQUOTAS; type++)
00163                 seq_printf(m, "    %s:\n"
00164                            "        #slv: %d\n"
00165                            "        #lqe: %d\n",
00166                            QTYPE_NAME(type),
00167                            pool->qpi_slv_nr[type],
00168                     atomic_read(&pool->qpi_site[type]->lqs_hash->hs_count));
00169 
00170         return 0;
00171 }
00172 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(qpi_state);
00173 
00174 static int qpi_soft_least_qunit_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00175 {
00176         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool = m->private;
00177         LASSERT(pool != NULL);
00178 
00179         return seq_printf(m, "%lu\n", pool->qpi_soft_least_qunit);
00180 }
00181 
00182 static ssize_t
00183 qpi_soft_least_qunit_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00184                                size_t count, loff_t *off)
00185 {
00186         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool;
00187         int     qunit, rc;
00188         s64     least_qunit;
00189 
00190         pool = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00191         LASSERT(pool != NULL);
00192 
00193         /* Not tuneable for inode limit */
00194         if (pool->qpi_key >> 16 != LQUOTA_RES_DT)
00195                 return -EINVAL;
00196 
00197         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &least_qunit);
00198         if (rc)
00199                 return rc;
00200 
00201         /* Miminal qpi_soft_least_qunit */
00202         qunit = pool->qpi_least_qunit << 2;
00203         /* The value must be power of miminal qpi_soft_least_qunit, see
00204          * how the qunit is adjusted in qmt_adjust_qunit(). */
00205         while (qunit > 0 && qunit < least_qunit)
00206                 qunit <<= 2;
00207         if (qunit <= 0)
00208                 qunit = INT_MAX & ~3;
00209 
00210         pool->qpi_soft_least_qunit = qunit;
00211         return count;
00212 }
00213 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(qpi_soft_least_qunit);
00214 
00215 static struct lprocfs_vars lprocfs_quota_qpi_vars[] = {
00216         { .name =       "info",
00217           .fops =       &qpi_state_fops },
00218         { .name =       "soft_least_qunit",
00219           .fops =       &qpi_soft_least_qunit_fops },
00220         { NULL }
00221 };
00222 
00223 /*
00224  * Allocate a new qmt_pool_info structure and add it to the pool hash table
00225  * of the qmt.
00226  *
00227  * \param env       - is the environment passed by the caller
00228  * \param qmt       - is the quota master target
00229  * \param pool_id   - is the 16-bit pool identifier of the new pool to add
00230  * \param pool_type - is the resource type of this pool instance, either
00231  *                    LQUOTA_RES_MD or LQUOTA_RES_DT.
00232  *
00233  * \retval - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00234  */
00235 static int qmt_pool_alloc(const struct lu_env *env, struct qmt_device *qmt,
00236                           int pool_id, int pool_type)
00237 {
00238         struct qmt_thread_info  *qti = qmt_info(env);
00239         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool;
00240         int                      rc = 0;
00241         ENTRY;
00242 
00243         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(pool);
00244         if (pool == NULL)
00245                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00246         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&pool->qpi_linkage);
00247 
00248         /* assign key used by hash functions */
00249         pool->qpi_key = pool_id + (pool_type << 16);
00250 
00251         /* initialize refcount to 1, hash table will then grab an additional
00252          * reference */
00253         atomic_set(&pool->qpi_ref, 1);
00254 
00255         /* set up least qunit size to use for this pool */
00256         pool->qpi_least_qunit = LQUOTA_LEAST_QUNIT(pool_type);
00257         if (pool_type == LQUOTA_RES_DT)
00258                 pool->qpi_soft_least_qunit = pool->qpi_least_qunit << 2;
00259         else
00260                 pool->qpi_soft_least_qunit = pool->qpi_least_qunit;
00261 
00262         /* create pool proc directory */
00263         sprintf(qti->qti_buf, "%s-0x%x", RES_NAME(pool_type), pool_id);
00264         pool->qpi_proc = lprocfs_register(qti->qti_buf, qmt->qmt_proc,
00265                                           lprocfs_quota_qpi_vars, pool);
00266         if (IS_ERR(pool->qpi_proc)) {
00267                 rc = PTR_ERR(pool->qpi_proc);
00268                 CERROR("%s: failed to create proc entry for pool %s (%d)\n",
00269                        qmt->qmt_svname, qti->qti_buf, rc);
00270                 pool->qpi_proc = NULL;
00271                 GOTO(out, rc);
00272         }
00273 
00274         /* grab reference on master target that this pool belongs to */
00275         lu_device_get(qmt2lu_dev(qmt));
00276         lu_ref_add(&qmt2lu_dev(qmt)->ld_reference, "pool", pool);
00277         pool->qpi_qmt = qmt;
00278 
00279         /* add to qmt hash table */
00280         rc = cfs_hash_add_unique(qmt->qmt_pool_hash, &pool->qpi_key,
00281                                  &pool->qpi_hash);
00282         if (rc) {
00283                 CERROR("%s: failed to add pool %s to qmt hash (%d)\n",
00284                        qmt->qmt_svname, qti->qti_buf, rc);
00285                 GOTO(out, rc);
00286         }
00287 
00288         /* add to qmt pool list */
00289         list_add_tail(&pool->qpi_linkage, &qmt->qmt_pool_list);
00290         EXIT;
00291 out:
00292         if (rc)
00293                 /* this frees the pool structure since refcount is equal to 1 */
00294                 qpi_putref(env, pool);
00295         return rc;
00296 }
00297 
00298 /*
00299  * Delete a qmt_pool_info instance and all structures associated.
00300  *
00301  * \param env  - is the environment passed by the caller
00302  * \param pool - is the qmt_pool_info structure to free
00303  */
00304 static void qmt_pool_free(const struct lu_env *env, struct qmt_pool_info *pool)
00305 {
00306         int     qtype;
00307         ENTRY;
00308 
00309         /* release proc entry */
00310         if (pool->qpi_proc) {
00311                 lprocfs_remove(&pool->qpi_proc);
00312                 pool->qpi_proc = NULL;
00313         }
00314 
00315         /* release per-quota type site used to manage quota entries as well as
00316          * references to global index files */
00317         for (qtype = 0; qtype < MAXQUOTAS; qtype++) {
00318                 /* release lqe storing grace time */
00319                 if (pool->qpi_grace_lqe[qtype] != NULL)
00320                         lqe_putref(pool->qpi_grace_lqe[qtype]);
00321 
00322                 /* release site */
00323                 if (pool->qpi_site[qtype] != NULL &&
00324                     !IS_ERR(pool->qpi_site[qtype]))
00325                         lquota_site_free(env, pool->qpi_site[qtype]);
00326                 /* release reference to global index */
00327                 if (pool->qpi_glb_obj[qtype] != NULL &&
00328                     !IS_ERR(pool->qpi_glb_obj[qtype]))
00329                         lu_object_put(env, &pool->qpi_glb_obj[qtype]->do_lu);
00330         }
00331 
00332         /* release reference on pool directory */
00333         if (pool->qpi_root != NULL && !IS_ERR(pool->qpi_root))
00334                 lu_object_put(env, &pool->qpi_root->do_lu);
00335 
00336         /* release reference on the master target */
00337         if (pool->qpi_qmt != NULL) {
00338                 struct lu_device *ld = qmt2lu_dev(pool->qpi_qmt);
00339 
00340                 lu_device_put(ld);
00341                 lu_ref_del(&ld->ld_reference, "pool", pool);
00342                 pool->qpi_qmt = NULL;
00343         }
00344 
00345         LASSERT(list_empty(&pool->qpi_linkage));
00346         OBD_FREE_PTR(pool);
00347 }
00348 
00349 /*
00350  * Look-up a pool in the hash table based on the pool ID and type.
00351  *
00352  * \param env     - is the environment passed by the caller
00353  * \param qmt     - is the quota master target
00354  * \param pool_id   - is the 16-bit identifier of the pool to look up
00355  * \param pool_type - is the type of this pool, either LQUOTA_RES_MD or
00356  *                    LQUOTA_RES_DT.
00357  */
00358 static struct qmt_pool_info *qmt_pool_lookup(const struct lu_env *env,
00359                                              struct qmt_device *qmt,
00360                                              int pool_id, int pool_type)
00361 {
00362         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool;
00363         __u32                    key;
00364         ENTRY;
00365 
00366         LASSERT(qmt->qmt_pool_hash != NULL);
00367 
00368         /* look-up pool in hash table */
00369         key = pool_id + (pool_type << 16);
00370         pool = cfs_hash_lookup(qmt->qmt_pool_hash, (void *)&key);
00371         if (pool == NULL) {
00372                 /* this qmt isn't managing this pool! */
00373                 CERROR("%s: looking up quota entry for a pool (0x%x/%d) which "
00374                        "isn't managed by this quota master target\n",
00375                        qmt->qmt_svname, pool_id, pool_type);
00376                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOENT));
00377         }
00378         RETURN(pool);
00379 }
00380 
00381 /*
00382  * Functions implementing the pool API, used by the qmt handlers
00383  */
00384 
00385 /*
00386  * Destroy all pools which are still in the hash table and free the pool
00387  * hash table.
00388  *
00389  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00390  * \param qmt - is the quota master target
00391  *
00392  */
00393 void qmt_pool_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct qmt_device *qmt)
00394 {
00395         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool;
00396         struct list_head        *pos, *n;
00397         ENTRY;
00398 
00399         if (qmt->qmt_pool_hash == NULL)
00400                 RETURN_EXIT;
00401 
00402         /* parse list of pool and destroy each element */
00403         list_for_each_safe(pos, n, &qmt->qmt_pool_list) {
00404                 pool = list_entry(pos, struct qmt_pool_info,
00405                                   qpi_linkage);
00406                 /* remove from hash */
00407                 cfs_hash_del(qmt->qmt_pool_hash, &pool->qpi_key,
00408                              &pool->qpi_hash);
00409 
00410                 /* remove from list */
00411                 list_del_init(&pool->qpi_linkage);
00412 
00413                 /* release extra reference taken in qmt_pool_alloc */
00414                 qpi_putref(env, pool);
00415         }
00416         LASSERT(list_empty(&qmt->qmt_pool_list));
00417 
00418         cfs_hash_putref(qmt->qmt_pool_hash);
00419         qmt->qmt_pool_hash = NULL;
00420         EXIT;
00421 }
00422 
00423 /*
00424  * Initialize pool configure for the quota master target. For now, we only
00425  * support the default data (i.e. all OSTs) and metadata (i.e. all the MDTs)
00426  * pool which are instantiated in this function.
00427  *
00428  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00429  * \param qmt - is the quota master target for which we have to initialize the
00430  *              pool configuration
00431  *
00432  * \retval - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00433  */
00434 int qmt_pool_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct qmt_device *qmt)
00435 {
00436         int     res, rc = 0;
00437         ENTRY;
00438 
00439         /* initialize pool hash table */
00440         qmt->qmt_pool_hash = cfs_hash_create("POOL_HASH",
00441                                              HASH_POOLS_CUR_BITS,
00442                                              HASH_POOLS_MAX_BITS,
00443                                              HASH_POOLS_BKT_BITS, 0,
00444                                              CFS_HASH_MIN_THETA,
00445                                              CFS_HASH_MAX_THETA,
00446                                              &qpi_hash_ops,
00447                                              CFS_HASH_DEFAULT);
00448         if (qmt->qmt_pool_hash == NULL) {
00449                 CERROR("%s: failed to create pool hash table\n",
00450                        qmt->qmt_svname);
00451                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00452         }
00453 
00454         /* initialize pool list */
00455         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&qmt->qmt_pool_list);
00456 
00457         /* Instantiate pool master for the default data and metadata pool (both
00458          * have pool ID equals to 0).
00459          * This code will have to be revisited once we support quota on
00460          * non-default pools */
00461         for (res = LQUOTA_FIRST_RES; res < LQUOTA_LAST_RES; res++) {
00462                 rc = qmt_pool_alloc(env, qmt, 0, res);
00463                 if (rc)
00464                         break;
00465         }
00466 
00467         if (rc)
00468                 qmt_pool_fini(env, qmt);
00469 
00470         RETURN(rc);
00471 }
00472 
00473 static int qmt_slv_cnt(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_fid *glb_fid,
00474                        char *slv_name, struct lu_fid *slv_fid, void *arg)
00475 {
00476         int *nr = arg;
00477 
00478         /* one more slave */
00479         (*nr)++;
00480 
00481         return 0;
00482 }
00483 
00484 /*
00485  * Set up on-disk index files associated with each pool.
00486  *
00487  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00488  * \param qmt - is the quota master target for which we have to initialize the
00489  *              pool configuration
00490  * \param qmt_root - is the on-disk directory created for the QMT.
00491  *
00492  * \retval - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00493  */
00494 int qmt_pool_prepare(const struct lu_env *env, struct qmt_device *qmt,
00495                      struct dt_object *qmt_root)
00496 {
00497         struct qmt_thread_info  *qti = qmt_info(env);
00498         struct lquota_glb_rec   *rec = &qti->qti_glb_rec;
00499         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool;
00500         struct dt_device        *dev = NULL;
00501         dt_obj_version_t         version;
00502         struct list_head        *pos;
00503         int                      rc = 0, qtype;
00504         ENTRY;
00505 
00506         LASSERT(qmt->qmt_pool_hash != NULL);
00507 
00508         /* iterate over each pool in the hash and allocate a quota site for each
00509          * one. This involves creating a global index file on disk */
00510         list_for_each(pos, &qmt->qmt_pool_list) {
00511                 struct dt_object        *obj;
00512                 int                      pool_type, pool_id;
00513                 struct lquota_entry     *lqe;
00514 
00515                 pool = list_entry(pos, struct qmt_pool_info,
00516                                   qpi_linkage);
00517 
00518                 pool_id   = pool->qpi_key & 0x0000ffff;
00519                 pool_type = pool->qpi_key >> 16;
00520                 if (dev == NULL)
00521                         dev = pool->qpi_qmt->qmt_child;
00522 
00523                 /* allocate directory for this pool */
00524                 sprintf(qti->qti_buf, "%s-0x%x", RES_NAME(pool_type), pool_id);
00525                 obj = lquota_disk_dir_find_create(env, qmt->qmt_child, qmt_root,
00526                                                   qti->qti_buf);
00527                 if (IS_ERR(obj))
00528                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(obj));
00529                 pool->qpi_root = obj;
00530 
00531                 for (qtype = 0; qtype < MAXQUOTAS; qtype++) {
00532                         /* Generating FID of global index in charge of storing
00533                          * settings for this quota type */
00534                         lquota_generate_fid(&qti->qti_fid, pool_id, pool_type,
00535                                             qtype);
00536 
00537                         /* open/create the global index file for this quota
00538                          * type */
00539                         obj = lquota_disk_glb_find_create(env, dev,
00540                                                           pool->qpi_root,
00541                                                           &qti->qti_fid, false);
00542                         if (IS_ERR(obj)) {
00543                                 rc = PTR_ERR(obj);
00544                                 CERROR("%s: failed to create glb index copy for"
00545                                        " %s type (%d)\n", qmt->qmt_svname,
00546                                        QTYPE_NAME(qtype), rc);
00547                                 RETURN(rc);
00548                         }
00549 
00550                         pool->qpi_glb_obj[qtype] = obj;
00551 
00552                         version = dt_version_get(env, obj);
00553                         /* set default grace time for newly created index */
00554                         if (version == 0) {
00555                                 rec->qbr_hardlimit = 0;
00556                                 rec->qbr_softlimit = 0;
00557                                 rec->qbr_granted = 0;
00558                                 rec->qbr_time = pool_type == LQUOTA_RES_MD ?
00559                                         MAX_IQ_TIME : MAX_DQ_TIME;
00560 
00561                                 rc = lquota_disk_write_glb(env, obj, 0, rec);
00562                                 if (rc) {
00563                                         CERROR("%s: failed to set default "
00564                                                "grace time for %s type (%d)\n",
00565                                                qmt->qmt_svname,
00566                                                QTYPE_NAME(qtype), rc);
00567                                         RETURN(rc);
00568                                 }
00569 
00570                                 rc = lquota_disk_update_ver(env, dev, obj, 1);
00571                                 if (rc) {
00572                                         CERROR("%s: failed to set initial "
00573                                                "version for %s type (%d)\n",
00574                                                qmt->qmt_svname,
00575                                                QTYPE_NAME(qtype), rc);
00576                                         RETURN(rc);
00577                                 }
00578                         }
00579 
00580                         /* create quota entry site for this quota type */
00581                         pool->qpi_site[qtype] = lquota_site_alloc(env, pool,
00582                                                                   true, qtype,
00583                                                                   &qmt_lqe_ops);
00584                         if (IS_ERR(pool->qpi_site[qtype])) {
00585                                 rc = PTR_ERR(pool->qpi_site[qtype]);
00586                                 CERROR("%s: failed to create site for %s type "
00587                                        "(%d)\n", qmt->qmt_svname,
00588                                        QTYPE_NAME(qtype), rc);
00589                                 RETURN(rc);
00590                         }
00591 
00592                         /* count number of slaves which already connected to
00593                          * the master in the past */
00594                         pool->qpi_slv_nr[qtype] = 0;
00595                         rc = lquota_disk_for_each_slv(env, pool->qpi_root,
00596                                                       &qti->qti_fid,
00597                                                       qmt_slv_cnt,
00598                                                       &pool->qpi_slv_nr[qtype]);
00599                         if (rc) {
00600                                 CERROR("%s: failed to scan & count slave "
00601                                        "indexes for %s type (%d)\n",
00602                                        qmt->qmt_svname, QTYPE_NAME(qtype), rc);
00603                                 RETURN(rc);
00604                         }
00605 
00606                         /* Global grace time is stored in quota settings of
00607                          * ID 0. */
00608                         qti->qti_id.qid_uid = 0;
00609 
00610                         /* look-up quota entry storing grace time */
00611                         lqe = lqe_locate(env, pool->qpi_site[qtype],
00612                                          &qti->qti_id);
00613                         if (IS_ERR(lqe))
00614                                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(lqe));
00615                         pool->qpi_grace_lqe[qtype] = lqe;
00616 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00617                         /* add procfs file to dump the global index, mostly for
00618                          * debugging purpose */
00619                         sprintf(qti->qti_buf, "glb-%s", QTYPE_NAME(qtype));
00620                         rc = lprocfs_seq_create(pool->qpi_proc, qti->qti_buf,
00621                                                 0444, &lprocfs_quota_seq_fops,
00622                                                 obj);
00623                         if (rc)
00624                                 CWARN("%s: Error adding procfs file for global"
00625                                       "quota index "DFID", rc:%d\n",
00626                                       qmt->qmt_svname, PFID(&qti->qti_fid), rc);
00627 #endif
00628                 }
00629         }
00630 
00631         RETURN(0);
00632 }
00633 
00634 /*
00635  * Handle new slave connection. Called when a slave enqueues the global quota
00636  * lock at the beginning of the reintegration procedure.
00637  *
00638  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00639  * \parap qmt - is the quota master target handling this request
00640  * \param glb_fid - is the fid of the global index file
00641  * \param slv_fid - is the fid of the newly created slave index file
00642  * \param slv_ver - is the current version of the slave index file
00643  * \param uuid    - is the uuid of slave which is (re)connecting to the master
00644  *                  target
00645  *
00646  * \retval - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00647  */
00648 int qmt_pool_new_conn(const struct lu_env *env, struct qmt_device *qmt,
00649                       struct lu_fid *glb_fid, struct lu_fid *slv_fid,
00650                       __u64 *slv_ver, struct obd_uuid *uuid)
00651 {
00652         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool;
00653         struct dt_object        *slv_obj;
00654         int                      pool_id, pool_type, qtype;
00655         bool                     created = false;
00656         int                      rc = 0;
00657 
00658         /* extract pool info from global index FID */
00659         rc = lquota_extract_fid(glb_fid, &pool_id, &pool_type, &qtype);
00660         if (rc)
00661                 RETURN(rc);
00662 
00663         /* look-up pool in charge of this global index FID */
00664         pool = qmt_pool_lookup(env, qmt, pool_id, pool_type);
00665         if (IS_ERR(pool))
00666                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(pool));
00667 
00668         /* look-up slave index file */
00669         slv_obj = lquota_disk_slv_find(env, qmt->qmt_child, pool->qpi_root,
00670                                        glb_fid, uuid);
00671         if (IS_ERR(slv_obj) && PTR_ERR(slv_obj) == -ENOENT) {
00672                 /* create slave index file */
00673                 slv_obj = lquota_disk_slv_find_create(env, qmt->qmt_child,
00674                                                       pool->qpi_root, glb_fid,
00675                                                       uuid, false);
00676                 created = true;
00677         }
00678         if (IS_ERR(slv_obj)) {
00679                 rc = PTR_ERR(slv_obj);
00680                 CERROR("%s: failed to create quota slave index file for %s (%d)"
00681                        "\n", qmt->qmt_svname, obd_uuid2str(uuid), rc);
00682                 GOTO(out, rc);
00683         }
00684 
00685         /* retrieve slave fid & current object version */
00686         memcpy(slv_fid, lu_object_fid(&slv_obj->do_lu), sizeof(*slv_fid));
00687         *slv_ver = dt_version_get(env, slv_obj);
00688         lu_object_put(env, &slv_obj->do_lu);
00689         if (created)
00690                 pool->qpi_slv_nr[qtype]++;
00691 out:
00692         qpi_putref(env, pool);
00693         RETURN(rc);
00694 }
00695 
00696 /*
00697  * Look-up a lquota_entry in the pool hash and allocate it if not found.
00698  *
00699  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00700  * \param qmt - is the quota master target for which we have to initialize the
00701  *              pool configuration
00702  * \param pool_id   - is the 16-bit identifier of the pool
00703  * \param pool_type - is the pool type, either LQUOTA_RES_MD or LQUOTA_RES_DT.
00704  * \param qtype     - is the quota type, either user or group.
00705  * \param qid       - is the quota ID to look-up
00706  *
00707  * \retval - valid pointer to lquota entry on success, appropriate error on
00708  *           failure
00709  */
00710 struct lquota_entry *qmt_pool_lqe_lookup(const struct lu_env *env,
00711                                          struct qmt_device *qmt,
00712                                          int pool_id, int pool_type,
00713                                          int qtype, union lquota_id *qid)
00714 {
00715         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool;
00716         struct lquota_entry     *lqe;
00717         ENTRY;
00718 
00719         /* look-up pool responsible for this global index FID */
00720         pool = qmt_pool_lookup(env, qmt, pool_id, pool_type);
00721         if (IS_ERR(pool))
00722                 RETURN((void *)pool);
00723 
00724         if (qid->qid_uid == 0) {
00725                 /* caller wants to access grace time, no need to look up the
00726                  * entry since we keep a reference on ID 0 all the time */
00727                 lqe = pool->qpi_grace_lqe[qtype];
00728                 lqe_getref(lqe);
00729                 GOTO(out, lqe);
00730         }
00731 
00732         /* now that we have the pool, let's look-up the quota entry in the
00733          * right quota site */
00734         lqe = lqe_locate(env, pool->qpi_site[qtype], qid);
00735 out:
00736         qpi_putref(env, pool);
00737         RETURN(lqe);
00738 }
